description: Production API service is completely down. All users are unable to access the application. Error logs show database connection timeout. Started approximately 10 minutes ago.

Security alert: Unauthorized access detected on admin panel from IP 192.168.1.100. Multiple failed login attempts followed by successful authentication with compromised credentials. Immediate investigation required.
Users reporting slow page load times on the main website. Average response time increased from 200ms to 3000ms over the last 30 minutes. CPU utilization at 85% on web servers.
Database backup job failed last night. Error indicates corrupted data in user_profiles table. Approximately 500 records may be affected. Current database is still operational.
Intermittent network connectivity issues between application servers and database cluster. Packet loss observed at 15%. DNS resolution working normally. Started 1 hour ago.
Recent deployment to production caused configuration mismatch. Application unable to connect to Redis cache. Error: 'Connection refused on port 6379'. Deployment was 30 minutes ago.
Disk space alert: Primary database server disk utilization at 95%. Transaction logs consuming most space. Application still functioning but performance degrading.
Minor UI bug: Submit button on contact form has misaligned text. Functionality works correctly. Only affects visual presentation. No user impact on operations.
Email notification service experiencing delays. Emails being queued but delivery taking 15-20 minutes instead of usual 1-2 minutes. All emails eventually delivered successfully.
Monitoring system detected unusual spike in API error rate. 500 errors increased from baseline 0.1% to 2.5%. Affecting /api/users endpoint only. Root cause unknown.
